loans.name: Mag

texts.en:
Mag works hard to support her family. She is married and has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines.

Mag requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a manicure set.

She has been in this business for 12 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

In the future, Mag would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy a manicure set.

loans.name: Alice    K

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Alice from Kandeh town Southern area in Bo. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 5 and 7 years. Her children are going to school. 

Alice runs a cookery business at her house. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business every day; she begins preparing food at 4:00am until it is finished and goes to market for the next day before she rests. She describes herself as hardworking woman and cookery is the best business for her because sales enable her to feed her children.

Alice has requested a loan in order to buy cooking seasoning, palm oil, and rice. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children school fees. In the future, she plans to open a big restaurant. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy cooking seasoning, palm oil, and rice.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 43 years old and married with six children. Three of her children are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Virginia has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Virginia has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, commercial maize, and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Joyah

texts.en: Joyah is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kandeh, which is in the Bo area of Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children who range in age from 5 to 20 years old. Three of her children currently attend school. In 2007, after learning how to run a business from her mother, she opened a general store where she now works every day, from morning to night. Her main business challenge is a lack of capital with which to operate and stock her store. Joyah is requesting a loan to buy clothing and palm oil to sell to her customers. She hopes that the extra income she earns from this this loan will allow her to educate her children and start a savings account. In the future, Joyah hope to open a big clothing store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothing and palm oil to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Diego Alexander

texts.es:
Diego Alexander, un joven de tan sólo 21 años de edad, pujante y con muchos deseos de salir adelante ha decidido montar su propio negocio de producción y venta de hortalizas aprovechando lo que mejor sabe hacer combinando su experiencia y su pasión por la agricultura. Este joven desea ser un gran empresario por lo cual recurre a un préstamo para comprar los insumos requeridos para iniciar su actividad económica debido a que no cuenta con recursos propios para ejecutar su idea.

Su gran sueño es poder proyectarse dentro del corto plazo como un gran empresario y por eso desea trabajar e ingresar a la Universidad para complementar su perfil empresarial.
texts.en:
Diego Alexander, a youth of only 21 years, thriving and with a lot of desire to move ahead, has decided to start his own business growing and selling vegetables, taking advantage of what he best knows how to do and combining his experience with his passion for agriculture. This youth wants to be a great businessman, so he is taking out a loan in order to buy the required supplies to start his business, since he does not have the resources himself to put his idea into practice.

His big dream is to be able to project himself as a great businessman in the short term, so he wants to work and enter the University to complement his entrepreneurial profile.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: Juan Ramón de 70 años vive junto a su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos, es un hombre muy trabajador que toda su vida se ha caracterizado por ser responsable en sus tareas y trabajos diarios, gracias a su manera de ser posee amigos y personas de buen corazón quienes le ayudan a seguir siendo un buen hombre honesto, alegre y sincero es el único que trabaja en su hogar y esto hace que sea mas responsable ya que de el depende que su familia tenga que comer. Juan se dedica al cultivo de insumos básicos como frijol, maíz, arroz pero específicamente al cultivo del pepino es por eso que humildemente se ha acercado a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar insumos para la siembra de pepinos como: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes,sulfato de amonio u otros. Confía en que pronto la ayuda sera recibida y podrá seguir brindando un buen futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón is 70 years old and lives together with his wife and his two small children. He is a very hard-working man who all his life has characterized himself as being responsible in his tasks and daily work. Thanks to his manner of being he has friends and people of good heart who help him to continue being a good honest man, happy and sincere. He is the only one who works in his home and this results in his being more responsible since his family having something to eat depends on him.

Juan is a farmer of basic inputs like beans, corn and rice but specifically for the farming of cucumber he humbly approached INTEGRAL to request a loan and be able to buy inputs for the sowing of cucumbers like: seeds, manure, fertilizers, sulphate of ammonium or others. He trusts that soon help will be received and he will be able to continue offering a good future to his family.

loans.use: to buy inputs for sowing cucumbers like: seeds, manure, fertilizers, sulphate of ammonium or others.

loans.name: Turemeshanye Group

texts.fr:
Odette fait partie du groupe  Turemeshanye  et habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 38 ans et mariée à Joseph, un garnisseur. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants  âgés de  11 à 18 ans. 

Elle fait le commerce du riz depuis  8 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité  du riz paddy à décortiquer pour vendre le riz blanc, afin de gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait importer du riz de Dubaï ou de l’Ouganda et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Odette is a member of the Turemeshanye group and lives in Bujumbura.  She is 38 years old and married to Joseph, who works as a stuffer.  They have two children together, ages 11 and 18.  She has been selling rice for the last eight years.

Odette is on her second loan with Turame.  With the Kiva credit she obtains, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of rice to husk and sell as white rice.  In the coming years she would like to import rice from Dubai or Uganda, and to see her children study.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large amount of rice to hull and sell as white rice.

loans.name: Lorlie

texts.en:
Lorlie is 46 years old and married with four children.

Lorlie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 11000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell, like sardines, snack foods, and other groceries.

Lorlie has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Lorlie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like sardines, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian is 34 years old and married with two children, ages four and eight. She runs a food stand business in Kandeh town in Sierra Leone. She's been in this business for six years and sells pepper, onions, cooking seasoning and rice at her house. She also receives income from relatives. She says that the main challenge to her business is its location. Marian requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to expand her business by purchasing rice, cooking seasoning, onions and tomato paste. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family's standard of living. In the future, she would like to see her business expand. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing rice, cooking seasoning, onions and tomato paste.

loans.name: Sayf

texts.en:
Sayf is from Iraq. He is a youth client aging 24 years, is married, and has two children. One of his parents lives with him and he is the only provider for the family.

Sayf owns a barber shop. He established his business in 2010 and now has an employee. He acquired skills in this profession by working as an employee in several barber shops. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2,400 youth loan to pay the annual rent for the shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 34 years old. He is married and has two children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize and beans and also keep cows and goats.

James looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, James will invest in hen rearing activities. He dreams of helping to develop the schools in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is 25 years old. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock. He grows maize, beans, rice, cassava and bananas. He also keeps cows, goats, sheep, pigs and chickens. 

Enock looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Enock will save up for a fish farming business that he would like to start. He dreams of opening up a technical school in his village.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Meet 36 year old Hannah from Torkpoi Town Bo, a southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 10 and 19 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2001, Hannah established her business. She began her business because she needed to raise income for the development of the home. She works at the business every day from morning to 11:00 p.m. at night.  She says that at present she is faced with insufficient capital to run the business. 

Hannah requires a loan in order to expand her shop by purchasing bundled water, soft drinks, and bagged sugar. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business   

In the future, Hannah plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to expand her shop by purchasing bundled water, soft drinks, and bagged sugar.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en: Nune is married with 2 children. She works at a local secondary school and also manages the household. She has a little farm where she grows tomatoes and corn. Nune also grows peach, pear, and apricot trees with great love and care. Because her farm business helps the family have some stable income, Nune has applied for this loan to expand her agricultural activities. With the requested loan, Nune will purchase fertilizer and seeds. The loan is very important for Nune to gather a good harvest, earn more income, and ensure her children’s livelihoods.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is 38 years old. He is married and has six children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans, and cassava. They also have cows, goats, sheep and chickens. 

Enock looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Enock will invest in the education of his children. He dreams of someday owning a car.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he can provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Mamie from Moriba town in the southern area of Bo. She is widowed with 6 children between the ages of 12 years and 30 years.

To earn a living, Mamie operates a palm oil business and sells retail goods in front of her house. She sells palm oil, cigarettes, and sweets. She has been running this business for the past 7 years. She works every day, 8 hours per day. She started this business to have a permanent source of income to support her household. She describes her major problems as insufficient capital to operate her business and transportation.

Mamie has requested a loan in order to buy a variety of items like palm oil, cigarettes, and sweets. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a big shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items like palm oil, cigarettes, and sweets

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en: Tigran is from Vostan village in the Ararat region. He is 48 years old and lives with his mother. Agriculture is the only source of income for Tigran to sustain his small family’s living. Tigran cultivates wheat, grows apricot trees, and also has a small grape orchard. With the requested loan, Tigran will purchase wheat seeds and fertilizer and will cover some of the operational costs associated with land cultivation. The loan is very important in order for Tigran to gather a good harvest and earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds and fertilizer and to cover some operational costs

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
Houssein is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 26 years. He is single and lives with three family members. He is the only provider.

Houssein is a cowman and has a small farm. He has acquired this profession while living in his village. In 1995, he established his own small farm. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. He is requesting a $2400 youth loan to buy a cow. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is from a small village in the Kareli district of Georgia. He is 21 years old, single and lives with his mother. He earns a living as a farmer, and owns a plot of land where he grows apples, tomatoes and green beans. He sells his produce in the local open market. He also runs a small dairy farm with two calves and two milk cows, and uses their milk to make products he sells locally. George works hard to set aside some savings and improve the living conditions of his family. He is requesting a loan to buy a new plot of land. He will use this additional piece of land to expand his business and grow more fruits and vegetables. He will also use a portion of the loan to cover the cost of preparing and cultivating the land. He plans to use the additional income he will earn to reinvest in his farming activities.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land and prepare and cultivate it.

loans.name: Sia

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Sia from Moriba town in the southern area of Bo. She is married with 8 children between the ages of 11 months and 25 years.  

Sia runs a fruit and vegetable business. She sells bananas, limes, and plantains. She has been running this business for the past 10 years. Her business is her only source of income. Her husband is an old man, so he does not bring home any income. Sia has to pay all of the expenses of the household while supporting her eight children at the same time. She decided to run a business in order to have a permanent source of income to support the home.  

Sia has requested a loan in order to buy more fruits like bananas, limes, and plantains. The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for her children and improve her living conditions. In the future, she hopes to establish a big business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more fruits like bananas, limes, and plantains.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is from a small village in the Kareli district. He is 50 years old, divorced and lives alone in his house. Badri is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a plot of land where apples and cabbages are grown. He does all relevant agricultural works to ensure a good quality of harvest. The harvested products are sold at the local open air market. Badri works hard to make some savings and improve his living conditions.
Badri requested a loan to purchase a plot of land. After buying another plot of land, he will expand his business and grow more fruits and vegetables. Thus he will receive increased income and reinvest in his agricultural activities. Badri awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 59 years old, and she is from a small village in the Martvili district. She lives with her parents, who are provided with a retirement pension. 

Madona requested loans from local financial institutions several times in order to start a family business, but she met with no success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of her low income and the family's poor living conditions. Currently, the family's only source of income is their agricultural business. Specifically, Madona has a cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. Madona sells the cheese locally in an open market at a good price. This activity provides hardly enough food for a three-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Madona's loan request was approved through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing credit with soft conditions for start-up and restart-up businesses to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. Madona requested a loan from Credo to purchase an additional milk cow. After purchasing the cow, she will be able to increase her cheese production, which will significantly increase the family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Aghavni

texts.en: Aghavni is a teacher. She lives in Artashat village in the Ararat region with her 29-year-old son. In addition to her work at the local school, Aghavni also runs a little farm where she grows peach and apricot trees. Because her orchard is small, Aghavni sells out her harvest before winter. That’s why Aghavni has applied for this loan to purchase 3 tons of fruit, which she will freeze to sell during the winter. With the loan’s help, Aghavni and her son will be able to have a stable income and invest in the development of their farm next year.

loans.use: to pay for 3 tons of fruit to freeze and sell during the winter

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is 34 years old and married with 5 children, aged between 1 and 14 years. She runs a food stand within her community in Kandeh town. She's been in this business for 10 years and sells rice, dry fish, pepper, onions and palm oil.  Her business is the only income she has. She says at present her business is doing well because she is the only one with a food stand in the area, so customers prefer buying her goods rather than going to the big market. 

Mariama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to develop her business by purchasing more rice, dry fish, pepper, onions and palm oil. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family’s living conditions and renovate her house. In the future, she would like to own a permanent structure where she can house her business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, dry fish, pepper, onions and palm oil.

loans.name: Baby

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 44-year-old Baby from Kandeh town. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 12 and 21 years. Two of her children attend school. Baby runs a retail business where she sells cigarettes, soap and biscuits. She has been running this business for 4 years. She operates her business every day, 10 hours per day. She also sells wood a side business to raise her income. She received some income from her daughter, who got married to a chief. 

Baby has requested a loan in order to buy more products to sell like soap, cigarettes, sugar and soft drinks. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children and expand her business.   In the future, she plans to open a big grocery shop . She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more products to sell like soap, cigarettes, sugar and soft drinks

loans.name: Anush

texts.en: Anush lives in Kapan town with her husband and son. She runs a shop where she sells food, utensils and drinks. She has been running this business for three years and now she wants to add more inventory to her shop to increase sales. With the loan’s help Anush wants to purchase supplies for her shop. This is important for her to meet her clients’ demands and stay competitive. The loan will help her to provide more prosperous conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her shop

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is a 22-year-old married man and the father of one child. He has been working in the coffee business since he was six years old. He didn't live a normal childhood or have much time to play because he had to take responsibility for his life and earn a living while still very young. Alaa is a hard worker who puts much effort into improving his business so that he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. He is applying for his second youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy materials for his business, including cups, spoons and bags, in addition to sugar and other items. His previous loan helped him increase his income by selling a greater variety of hot drinks. He hopes to provide his family and especially his child with best childhood ever and will make sure that educating him is his top priority, since he didn't get the chance to even finish his elementary education.

loans.use: to buy materials for a beverage-selling business.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en: Samvel is 55 years old and lives with his wife in Kapan town. He is a teacher at a local collage and is also engaged in agriculture. Together with his wife, Samvel keeps livestock, including three cows, 30 chickens and 15 bee colonies. He is applying for a loan to increase his livestock herd by buying a cow and a heifer. This larger herd will help Samvel earn more income and expand his farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a heifer.

loans.name: Jose Arturo

texts.es: Jose de 55 años de edad, vive junto a su familia es un hombre muy emprendedor que cada mañana despiertas con nuevas ilusiones y deseos de superación para el y su familia. Siempre ha sido responsable y honesto lo que mas le importa es su bienestar y el de quienes lo acompañan en este caso seria su familia. Jose de dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como, frijol, arroz, maíz y también al cultivo de jocote y loroco siendo esta su fuente de trabajo y la responsable que ne su hogar no falte el pan de cada día. lamenta mucho acudir a esta institución pues sabe que no cuenta con los recursos necesario ni el capital suficiente para incrementar mas sus ganancias ya que gran parte de lo que cosecha lo vende pero necesita insumos básicos para seguir con esta labor es por eso que se acerco a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder así comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas,  u otros espera su ayuda sea escuchada y pronto gozar de esta para que siga brindándole una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 55 years old. He lives with his family. He is a man with an entrepreneurial spirit; each morning he wakes up with new ideas and dreams for how he can help his family get ahead. He has always been a responsible and honest person. The thing that is most important to him is his well being, and the well being of those close to him, in this case it would be his family. 

Jose makes a living growing crops of basic grains, like beans, rice and corn; he also cultivates jocote and loroco. This is his source of income and what allows him to be responsible for his household never going without. 

It makes him sad to have to go to this communal bank, because it means that he does not have the resources necessary or the sufficient capital to be able to increase his income. He has already sold a large part of his harvest, but he needs basic supplies to be able to continue with his work. It is for this reason that he approached INTEGRAL about taking out a loan. He will use the loan to buy seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, pesticides and other supplies. He hopes that his request for help is heard so that soon he will be able to take advantage of this opportunity to continue providing his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Mameh

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Mameh from Torkpoi town in the southern area of Bo. She is widowed with five children between the ages of 12 years and 27 years.

Mameh runs a pharmacy where she sells malarial tablets, pain tablets and Oral hydration Salt (ORS) within her community. She has been running this business for five years alongside her general stock business to raise another source of income in the home. She works at the business every day, from morning to night. Mameh started this business after the death of her husband so she can make income to support the family. She says that the main challenges to her business are the high cost of products and insufficient capital to operate her pharmacy business.

Mameh has requested a loan in order to expand her pharmacy business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her capital and improve herself and her family's welfare. In the future, she plans to open a big pharmacy store. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to expand her pharmacy business.

loans.name: Simizar

texts.en: Simizar lives with her husband Sedrak and 2 children. She is involved in agriculture. She runs a farm where she grows a large variety of fruit trees: peach, apricot, plum, apple and pear. Being involved in agriculture more than 30 years has given Simizar an opportunity to be one of the best farmers in the area. She has applied for this loan to purchase seeds for cultivation and to renovate her old greenhouse. As Simizar wants to continue the expansion of her farm, the loan is very important for her. With the loan’s help she will increase her income and create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for cultivation and to renovate her greenhouse

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old. He is married and has two children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans, cassava, millet and bananas. They keep cows and goats. They also earn money by producing and selling charcoal and bricks.

James looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, James will invest in his cows to increase their milk production. He dreams of being a model farmer for his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 30 years old. He is married and has two children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow vegetables and also raise chickens. 

John looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, John will grow his farming business. His biggest dream is to be a veterinarian.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Falah

texts.en: Falah is from Iraq. He is 58 years old, married and has four children. He is the only provider for the family. He owns a shop for home electrical supplies. He started working in this field as an employee in an electronics shop and, after having a good experience, he established his own business in 2009. He has an employee now. He has built a good reputation in his local community. Falah is requesting a loan of $3,000 to pay his annual commercial rent and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his annual commercial rent and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine lives in Vedi village in the Ararat region with her 2 children. She works at a local kindergarten and also is involved in agriculture. She runs a farm where she cultivates tomatoes, eggplant, and cucumbers, and grows peach, pear and apple trees. She also keeps livestock, which currently includes 20 chickens. Karine has applied for this loan to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizer, and also to cover some transportation and cultivation costs. With the loan’s help Karine will develop her farm and have a stable source of income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizer, and to cover transportation and cultivation costs.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy, a single mother of 2 children, also pays school fees for one of her siblings who is in secondary school.
Being a single mother, she started a mini supermarket to make ends meet. She works all the days of the week to be able to make more money. Her supermarket is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are residents of the area. She gets busy in the evenings when people are commuting back home from town. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and the rampant strikes in the city which disrupt business. It is almost the festive season, so Prossy will use the loan to buy more items before the prices increase. She hopes that with the items purchased, she will be able to meet customer needs. Prossy is self motivated.

loans.use: To buy items to restock in the supermarket.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 28 years old. He is married and has seven children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans, cassava, bananas, groundnuts and peas. They raise cows, goats, sheep and chickens. They also have a small shop.

David looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, David plans to pay school fees for his children. He dreams of being a model farmer for his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en: Hasmik lives in Aygezard village of Ararat region with her family. Together with her family, Hasmik is involved in agriculture. She keeps 15 chickens, 15 turkeys and also grows a large variety of fruit trees: peach, pear, apricot, apple and nut. With the requested amount, Hasmik will purchase 4 pigs, fertilizer and stakes for the grape orchard. This will help her to expand her business and cover some cultivation costs. The loan is very important for Hasmik because farming is the sole financial income for this family.

loans.use: to pay for 4 pigs, fertilizer, stakes for the grape orchard and cultivation costs

loans.name: Sabr Group

texts.en:
This group is called Sabr and consists of 4 ladies. They are hardworking women who live in Taiz, Yemen. 

Sameera is a 49-year-old married woman with 8 children from Taiz, Yemen. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER to buy incense and perfumes to resell to her friends and neighbors. She wants to expand the products she has available. In the future she hopes to expand her project by opening a shop.

loans.use: to buy Incense, perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en: Morris is a 35 year old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 2 to 12 years. He describes himself as diligent. He operates a farm where he sells farm produce. His business is located on agricultural land and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 26,500 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by his six family members. His business goal is to improve his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy land and build a permanent house for his family. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM after the previous one of Kes 20,000 which he managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Carmen Segunda

texts.es: Carmen de 49 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de calzado y prendas de plata, en el municipio de Palmar, ubicado en el departamento del Atlántico, donde vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 6 a 18 años. Ella inicialmente trabajaba en casa  de familia y poco a poco logró ahorrar y empezó a invertir en pocas mercancías; gradualmente   fue construyendo su clientela,  que hoy  ha consolidado y les vende a crédito,  en plazos pactados con el comprador a un mes. Ella ha recibido 2 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización, que la ha apoyado en su crecimiento y el aumento de su bienestar  y el de su familia. En la actualidad el mercado tiene una demanda,  a la cual no puede responder con el dinero de su recuperación de cartera, porque no lograría satisfacerla. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva,  financiamiento con le cual comprará calzado y prendas de plata, aprovechando que se acercan las navidades y el año nuevo y su clientela ya ha hecho pedidos,  para lucir elegantes en estas lindas fiestas de fin de año, las cuales desean disfrutar unidos a su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is 49 years old and works selling shoes and silver jewelry in the town of Palmar, located in the department of Atlántico, where she lives with her spouse and their three children, who are ages between six and eighteen. She used to work as a domestic and was able to save up money little by little and invested in some merchandise. She gradually built her customer base, which is now well-established. She makes her sales on credit and works out one-month repayment terms with the buyers. 

She has twice received financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. This organization has helped her grow and increase her and her family's wellbeing. There is currently a market demand to which she can't respond with the returns on her sales, because that money wouldn't be enough to satisfy it. That is why she is requesting a Kiva loan. She will use this financing to purchase shoes and silver jewelry, especially since Christmas and New Year's Eve are approaching and her customers have already placed orders in order to dress up for the holidays, which they want to enjoy with their families.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Mauricio Michael

texts.es:
Mauricio Michael tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC Luchando por una misma Causa, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto la Primavera, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Mauricio Michael se dedica a la Agricultura  al siembra de maíz, fréjol. El dinero lo Utilizará para comprar semillas, insumos, abonos,urea, ranger. Con la ayuda del  crédito podrá mejorar los cultivos. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad Ventanas. El sueño es remodelar la casa y poner un sistema de riego a los sembríos.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas la langosta. En el tiempo libre le gusta chatear en el internet.
texts.en:
Mauricio Michael, 21, is single with no children and lives with his parents in Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. 

He is a member of the “Luchando por Una Misma Causa” (Striving for the Same Cause) communal bank which is located in Recinto La Primavera belonging to Ventanas Canton. This communal bank is involved in agricultural work related to short cycle corn and rice farming.

Mauricio Michael farms corn and beans. He will use the money to buy seed, supplies, fertilizer, urea and Ranger (insecticide). With the help of the loan he will be able to improve his crops. He’ll make his purchases in Ventanas. His dream is to remodel his house and install an irrigation system for the crops. 

The challenges he faces are the locust plague. In his free time he likes to chat online.

loans.use: to buy seed, supplies, fertilizer, urea and Ranger (insecticide).

loans.name: Rina Del Carmen

texts.es: Rina de 36 años de edad  vive con su familia. Es mujer muy emprendedora muy amable, honesta, y trabajadora con lo que mas le gusta hacer es muy conocida por trabajadora por sus vecinos cercanos. Rina es una mujer con muchas capacidades las cuales la hacen ver como una gran mujer se dedica a la siembra de insumos básicos, siendo esta su fuente de trabajo y es así como se gana la vida honradamente, también desea tener gallinas para venderlas y seguir siendo una bendición para su familia,  es por eso que se acerco a INTEGRAL para solicitar un  crédito y así comprar insumos básicos como : semillas, fertilizantes, pesticidas, abonos entre otros, y también las gallinas para luego venderlas . Espera que pronto su ayuda tenga respuesta y agradece a DIOS todo poderoso por gran bendición que recibirá.
texts.en:
Rina is 36 years old, and lives with her family. She is an honest, kind and entrepreneurial woman who is known among her neighbors and community for being a hardworking person. Rina has many abilities and talents, and she works as a farmer and cultivates staple crops to generate income and make an honest living.

Rina wants to branch out and use some of the support from this loan to purchase chickens for resale. She hopes that this expansion of her business will be a blessing to her family. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, manure and other items for maintaining her crops. Rina hopes that this investment will strengthen and grow her business and crops, and she is grateful to God for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase basic farming input items, including seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, manure and other items for her crops, as well as chickens for resale.

loans.name: Gregorio Antonio

texts.es:
GREGORIO ANTONIO tiene 32 años de edad de estado civil reciente unión libre, vive con la esposa en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC Luchando por una misma Causa, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto la Primavera, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Gregorio Antonio se dedica a la siembras de maíz y fréjol, El dinero lo utilizará par la compra de semillas, insumos. Con el dinero del credito podrá hacer cercer los cultivos.

Las compras y las ventas lo hara en la ciudad de Ventnas. el sueño es seguir trabajando para tener ingresos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas la paja de burro y la langosta, En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor, boly.
texts.en:
GREGORIO ANTONIO is 32 years old. He has recently entered into a common-law marriage. He lives with his wife in Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the communal bank "Luchando por una misma Causa" ["Fighting for a Common Cause"], which is located in the area of Primavera, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. The members of this communal bank work in agriculture, planting corn and rice on a short-cycle basis. 

Gregorio Antonio works growing corn and beans. He will use the funds to buy seeds and supplies. With the funds from the loan he will be able to fence in his crops. 

He makes his purchases and sales in the city of Ventanas. His dream is to keep working in order to have income. The challenges he confronts are weeds such as paja de burro and langosta. In his free time, he likes to play indoor soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Muze Ii Group

texts.fr:
Annociate fait partie du groupe  Muze II  et habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 32 ans et mariée à Déogratias, un commerçant de matériaux de construction. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants  âgés de 6 mois à 8 ans,dont 2 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce des matériaux de construction(fer à béton, ciments, clous,...) depuis  6 ans. 

Elle est à son quinzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité  de  matériaux de construction (fer à béton, ciments, clous,...) à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait  achever  sa maison,actuellement en cours de construction, et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en: Annociate belongs to the Muze II group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 32-years old and is married to Deogratias, a merchant of construction materials. Together, they have three children, ages 6 months to 8 years, two of which attend school. For six years, she has been in the business of construction materials (rebar, cement, nails...) She is on her fifteenth loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of construction supplies (rebar, cement, nails...) for resale to earn more.  In the coming years, she would like to finish building her home, currently under construction and see her children study.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of construction materials.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 33-year-old married man, and father of three children. Ahmad has been working in producing and selling food for 17 years. He is an expert in his work, specializing in preparing and selling pickles.  He also makes a special small white dough ball used as a main course, called Moghrabieh in Lebanon, similar to couscous but a larger product.
Ahmad is applying for his fifth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase the quantity of food he produces and sells  so that he can increase income and buy necessary plastic bags. He will also pay for his children's school fees.
His previous loans helped him a lot in improving his family's social and financial situations in a very impressive way.
He hopes to open a new branch in the future to expand his working region.

loans.use: to buy additional products to increase the quantity of pickles he produces and sells, and to pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tooth paste, bath soap, tissue rice, to enhance her  business.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 27-year-old single young man. For the past four years, Sami has had a store of electrical appliances and electrical extensions. It is the only store of its type in the area where Sami lives, which makes the project distinguished and it enjoys good customer demand. This project has been a profitable one and the only source of income to Sami, but it needs more support to cover costs.

Sami is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing electrical goods and extensions that customers often buy and use. This will increase sales, Sami's income, and ensure better living conditions.

Sami is photographed inside his store.

loans.use: To purchase electrical goods to sell

loans.name: Sofik

texts.en: Sofik is 32 years old, married with two sons and lives in Kapan town of Syunik region. Sofik and her husband are involved in beekeeping and now they have 10 colonies of bees. Sofik has applied for this loan to increase the number of bee colonies. She plans to purchase 20 more colonies of bees, which will allow her to gather more honey and sell it in the local markets. The loan is very important for Sofik to cover her household costs and ensure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to pay for 20 colonies of bees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed

loans.name: Mahdiya

texts.en:
Mahdiya is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in the grocery store he has.
Mahdiya is 41 years old and has two sons and two daughters, 12 to 18 years old, and all in school.
For the past three years, Mahdiya's husband has had a store selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project and the only source of income to the family, but also it needs more support to cover some of the costs.
Mahdiya is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing needed stocks of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, canned and frozen food and dairy products. This will increase sales and increase the family's income and ensure better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of basic groceries that customers often request

loans.name: Godberthe

texts.en: Godberthe is 77 years old and sells sorghum. She has spent 25 years in the business. She wants the loan to buy more metric tones of sorghum for sale. She plans to use the profits for providing food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Elevanie

texts.en: Elevanie is 56 years old. She is a widow with four children. She sells bananas and has spent two years in the business. She wants this loan to buy more bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: La Granjita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se encuentra conformado por personas fuertes, trabajadoras, empujados por las ganas de salir adelante y de obtener mejores ingresos económicos para su familia.

La presidenta de este grupo es la señora Rosa, doña Rosa se define como una mujer humilde, trabajadora, amable, honesta y que ama a su familia, cualidades personales que le han hecho ser merecedora del aprecio y la confianza de toda su comunidad viendo en ella una mujer de ejemplo.

El crédito que están solicitando a Fodemi es para la compra de ganado, vacas reproductoras, que den leche para salir a vender a su comunidad y así obtener mayores ingresos ya que es una oportunidad de crecer en su pequeño negocio.

El sueño que doña Rosa tiene es el tener una finca de ganado donde ella pueda vender y distribuir carne de ganado y leche, trabajar junto a su esposo y poder obtener un mayor ingreso económico, logrando así mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of this solidarity group are strong, hardworking people who are driven by their eagerness to get ahead and obtain better financial income for their families.

Rosa is the President of this group. Rosa says she is a humble, hardworking, kind, and honest woman who loves her family. All of these personal qualities have earned her the appreciation and trust of her entire community, who see her as a role model.

The loan they are requesting from Fodemi is to purchase cattle and dairy cows that will produce milk for them to sell in their community so that they can obtain higher incomes. This is an opportunity for their small business to grow.

Rosa's dream is to have a cattle ranch where she can sell beef and milk, work alongside her husband, and manage to obtain more financial income so that they can improve their quality of life and give their children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and dairy cows.

loans.name: Jose Heriberto

texts.es:
José, solicita un préstamo, para fortalecer el negocio, ya que comprara un surtido de pan dulce y francés, para realizar la venta diariamente, con esto será una nueva oportunidad de trabajar bien en el negocio y realizar más ganancias. 
Con el préstamo anterior logro la compra de bicicletas para contratar a dos personas para la venta de pan ambulante, con ellos ha podido trabajar en este periodo, su condición de vida está mejorando y sus hijos continúan estudiando.
texts.en:
Jose is requesting a loan to strengthen his business.  He will buy more sweet bread and French bread for his daily sales. With this investment, he will have a new opportunity for  his business and will increase his earnings.

With his previous loan, he bought bicycles so that he could hire 2 people to sell the bread from place to place.  With these, he has been able to work over this period, his living conditions are improving and his children have been able to stay in school.

loans.use: to buy sweet bread and French bread

loans.name: Los Progresistas De Cupiche Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Progresistas De Cupiche” conformado por 07 socios responsables dedicados a distintas actividades comerciales, la cual pasan a su 7 ciclo, siendo Albina una de las socias. Ella tiene 47 años de edad, conviviente con 03 hijos 02 de ellos aún dependientes. Albina cuenta con una pequeña bodega en su vivienda la cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad, lleva más de 04 años en dicho negocio. Fue la necesidad de brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida la que la motivo a emprender dicho negocio. Su mayor deseo es de ver a sus hijos profesionales, es por ello que trabaja mucho. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas y de esta manera tener surtida su bodega. El grupo “Los Progresistas De Cupiche” agradecen el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso. Albina es la primera del lado izquierdo viste chaleco color beige
texts.en:
The “Los Progresistas De Cupiche” group, made up of 7 responsible members with diverse businesses who are committed to the Program, is entering its 7th loan cycle with. 

Albina is one of the members. She is 47 years old, living with 3 children, 2 of whom are still dependent. Albina has a small grocery store where she offers convenience store items, she has spent more than 4 years in this business. It was the need to give her family a better quality of life which motivated her to undertake this enterprise. Her biggest dream is to see her children become professionals, that is why she is working so much. She will allocate her latest loan to buying grocery store items, sweets and drinks and thereby keep her store well-stocked. 

The "Los Progresistas De Cupiche” group is grateful for the loan given as it makes its progress possible. Albina is the first person on the left, wearing a beige jacket.

loans.use: to buy groceries, sweets and drinks.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su primer ciclo es un comité responsable. Podemos hablar de la Sra. Teresa quien es una señora que estuvo en grupo que deserto pero ella quiso seguir trabajando y se unió a otro grupo para seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia. Es muy activa y sacrificada, vive en una humilde casa en el barrio con sus seis hijos. Ella se dedica al reciclaje, y por medio de su trabajo está saliendo adelante. Día a día recorre para recolectar productos reciclados, como ser plásticos, cartones y demás.
Teresa está orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo digno y honesto. Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de plásticos, y aluminio por cantidad para poder revenderlos y de esa forma poder un mayor ingreso. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y su grupo están recibiendo.
texts.en:
This communal bank is in its first loan cycle, and it is a responsible group. One example is Señora Teresa, a woman who was in a [different] group which she left, but she wanted to continue working and she joined another group to continue working and helping her family. She is very active and sacrificing. She lives in a simple house in the neighborhood with her six children. She works in recycling, and through this work she is advancing. She says that she goes out every day to collect recyclable products such as plastics, cardboard, and other items.

Teresa says that she is proud of what she does, since it is dignified and honest work. She is applying for this loan to buy plastics and aluminum in quantity so that she can resell it, and in this way she will be able to have a greater income. She is grateful for the opportunity that she and her group are receiving.

loans.use: to buy plastics and aluminum to sell

loans.name: Saira Eveling

texts.es:
SAIRA EVELING tiene 23 años de edad es casada no tiene hijos, vive con el esposo en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La ventanilla UNIDOS VENCEREMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto América, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

 SAIRA EVELING se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de máiz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, fertilizantes.

 Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. Con la ayuda del credito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras. El sueño es comprarce una casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbool. 
"Esta muy agradecida por el credito anterior que le ha servido de mucho para las siembras".
texts.en:
Saira Eveling is twenty-three years old and married with no children.  She lives with her husband in Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. 

The communal bank "UNICOS VENCEREMOS" [United We Will Overcome"] is located in the América district, which is part of the Ventanas canton.  The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas. 

Saira Eveling makes a living in agriculture growing corn and rice.  She is requesting a loan to buy urea, insecticide, and fertilizer.

She buys what she needs in the city of Ventanas.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy the fertilizers for planting.  Her dream is to buy a house for herself.  In her free time, she likes to play soccer.  She is very thankful for the previous loan that has served her well in sowing her seeds.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticide, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Eusebia Maria

texts.es:
Eusebia Maria  tiene 51 años de edad es casada tiene una hija, vive con el esposo y con la hija en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

 Es integrante da la VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito I, perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.

Eusebia Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 15 años. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido para convatir las plagas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras. Las compras y las ventas las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. 
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. El sueño es comprarse un carro y ver a la hija terminar los estudios. En el tiempo libre le gusta charlar con la familia.

 "Esta muy agradecida por la ayuda del anterior crédito porque pudo comprar lo necesario para las siembras y mejorarón los ingresos para la familia."
texts.en: Eusebia María is fifty-one and lives with her husband and daughter in the town of Ventanas, in Los Ríos Province.  She is a member of VRC JERUSALEN which is situated in Recinto Caimito I, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in the Pueblo Viejo region.  This solidarity group specialises in the cultivation of short-cycle crops, such as corn, rice and pigeon peas.  Eusebia María has been growing corn and rice for 15 years.  The loan which she is applying for will enable her to buy seeds, insecticide, urea (a liquid for controlling pests) and fertiliser for her crops.  She will do her buying and selling in the town of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.  She has to face the twin challenges of pests and bad weather.  Her dream is to buy herself a car and see her daughter complete her schooling.  In her free time she likes to chat with her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide and urea, a liquid for controlling pests.

loans.name: Washington Saturno

texts.es:
Washington Saturno tiene 39 años de edad es casado tiene cuatro hijos, vive con los hijos y la esposa en la ciudad de ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito I, perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul. 

Washington Saturno se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 30 años. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza y pagar a los jornaleros. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el abono para la siembra. Las compras y las ventas las realizará en San Jacinto. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. 

El sueño es comprarse una finca y sembrar cacao. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol y boly.
texts.en:
Washington Saturno is thirty-nine years old and is married with four children.  He lives with his children and wife in the city of Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province.  He is a member of the "JERUSALEN" communal bank; it is located in the town of El Caimito, which belongs to Puerto Pechiche parish in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, planting corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Washington Saturno has been doing farm work with corn and rice crops since he was eight years old.  He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, insecticide, urea, liquid weed-killer, and to pay the day laborers.  With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy the fertilizers he needs for his crops.  

He does his buying and selling in the city of Ventanas, in the Los Rios province.  The challenges he faces are the plagues and the bad climate.

His dream is to buy a farm and to plant cacao.  In his free time he likes to play soccer and volleyball.  He is very thankful for his previous loan because he was able to buy what was necessary for his crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, urea, liquid weed-killer, and to pay the day laborers.

loans.name: Roly Andres

texts.es:
Roly Andres  tiene 25 años de edad de estado civil unión liretiene un hijo de 5 meses de edad, vive con el hijo y con el conyugue en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito I, perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul. 

Roly Andres se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz,  arroz desde hace 6 años atras. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras.   

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. 
El sueño es arreglar la casa y comprarce un carro. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor y boli.
"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda del anterior crédito porque pudo comprar lo necesario para las siembras"
texts.en:
Roly Andrés, 25, lives in a common-law relationship and has a five-month-old child.  He lives with his child and with his spouse in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  He's a member of Jerusalán Communal Bank, located in the El Caimito I neighborhood in Puerto Pechiche Parish, Pueblo Viejo Canton. This communal bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Roly Andrés has made a living in agriculture for 6 years, growing corn and rice.  He's requesting the loan to buy insecticide, urea, liquid weedkiller, and fertilizer.  The loan will help him buy fertilizer for planting his crops.

He'll make his purchases and sales in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  The challenges he faces are pests and bad weather.

His dream is to fix up his house and buy himself a car.  In his free time he likes to play indoor soccer and volleyball.  "He's very grateful for the help of the previous loan because he was able to buy what he needed for sowing season."

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea, liquid weedkiller, and fertilizer

loans.name: Jefferson Alexi

texts.es:
Jefferson Alexi  tiene 23 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijas, vive con la conyugue los padres y las hijas en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito I, perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul. 

Jefferson Alexi  se dedica a la agricultura desde corta edad pero a los 15 años se dedicó más a las siembras de ciclo corto.
Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el abono para la siembra. Las compras y las ventas las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas cómo el orosco y la langosta. El sueño es comprarse una casa y mejorar el ámbito económico. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boly.

"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda del anterior crédito porque pudo comprar lo necesario para la siembra y por ello mejorarón los ingresos para la familia."
texts.en:
Jefferson Alexi is twenty-three years old and is in a civil union relationship.  He has two daughters.  He lives with his partner, his parents, and his daughters in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the “Jerusalen” communal bank, which is located in Recinto El Caimito and belongs to the Puerto Pechiche Parish in the Pueblo Viejo canton. This communal bank is dedicated to the short-cycle farming of corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Jefferson Alexi has worked in agriculture since he was little, but at the age of fifteen he decided to dedicate himself more to short-cycle farming.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, insecticide, urea, and liquid weed-killer.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy fertilizers for his crops.  He does all his buying and selling in the city of Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province.  The challenges he faces are crop diseases, like "orosco" and "langosta".   

His dream is to buy himself a house and to better his economic situation.  In his free time he likes to play volleyball.  He is very thankful for the help from the previous loan because he was able to buy what was necessary for his crops and he increased his family's income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, urea, and liquid weed-killer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a grill, meat, flour and soft drinks.

loans.name: Tineere Group

texts.fr:
Mme CLEMENTINE est responsable du  groupe TINEERE.  Elle se porte bien ainsi que tout le groupe. Dans la photo,  elle est au milieu entrain de servir le repas. Mariée, elle est mère de deux (02) enfants. Le plus âgé a 04ans et le moins âgés à 02 ans. Personne ne va à l’école et elle a (02) personnes  en charge.
Mme fait la restauration  depuis 03ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter  02 sacs de riz et 01 sac et demi de grain d’arachide.
Elle  veut mieux s’occuper de sa famille avec ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne toujours ouvrir un restaurant.
texts.en: Ms. Clementine is the leader of the Tineere group. She and the entire group are doing well. In the photo, she is in the middle, serving a meal.  Clementine is married and mother of two children; the oldest is 4-years old and the youngest is 2. Neither attend school and she has two other dependents.  Clementine has been preparing and serving food for three years.  She stocks up at the market in her area. Her customers are women and men. She wants to buy two bags of rice and one and a half bags of peanut grains.  She wants to take better care of her family with her profits.  Clementine still aspires to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy two bags of rice and one and a half bags of peanut grains.

loans.name: Wcsl Pri Kapethe Group

texts.en: Greetings are coming to you from members of the WSCL primary school, Kapethe village, near Makeni city. They are very grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan they have just repaid. With the help of that loan, they were able to meet their immediate financial needs. Some paid school fees for their children, others invested the loan in business, etc. Having completed repayment of that loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan in order to further solve their immediate financial needs. This time, featured leader Jonathan is going to use his share of the loan to buy house building materials like cement and iron corrugated zinc for the construction of a family dwelling.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like cement and iron corrugated zinc for the construction of a family dwelling

loans.name: Viviane

texts.en: Viviane is a 50 year old widow. She sells fish and has been in the business for twenty years. With the loan, she wants to buy more fish to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide the basic needs for her family of ten children.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: J.claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 34 years old and is married with one child who is six years old. Jean Claude owns his own transportation business. He has six years of experience in this work and he works from 5 a.m to 11 p.m. 

Jean Claude has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase spare parts for his car to ensure more profits. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is a 32 year old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 8 years. He describes himself to be hard working. 
Nathan operates a retail business where he sells clothes. His business is located within a market area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the 12,900 KES loan to buy a solar lamp that will be used by his family of five for lighting during the night. 
Nathan's business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM, after the previous one of 20,000 KES, which he managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of rice.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Madeleine est une femme célibataire qui vit sur le territoire sénégalais et s’active dans le secteur du commerce depuis un an. Elle pratique la vente de pâte d’arachide. Elle commence sa journée de travail a 8 heures le matin pour terminer a 17h. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour s’approvisionner en pâte d’arachide qu’elle va revendre a ses clients.
texts.en: Madeleine is a single woman who lives in Senegal. She has been in the business of selling peanut paste for one year.  She starts her work day at 8 am and ends at 5 pm.  She is a member of UIMCEC where she is asking for a loan of 400,000 frs in order to stock up on peanut paste that she will resell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy peanut paste.

loans.name: Alexandra Candelaria

texts.es:
Alexandra Candelaria tiene 34 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y el conyugue en Ventanas.

Es Integrante de la VRC Luchando por una misma Causa, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto la Primavera, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz. 

Alexandra Candelaria  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, fertilizantes, insumos.Compra y vende los productos en Ventanas.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá aumentar los sembrios. El sueño es realizar todas las remodelaciones de la casa.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son la plaga paja de burro. En elt iempo libre le gusta ver televisión.

Le gusta hacer la limpieza en la casa y lavar.
texts.en:
Alexandra Candelaria is 34 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and has two children. She lives with her two kids and her spouse in Ventanas. She belongs to the communal bank Luchando por una Misma Causa, located in La Primavera, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. The members of this communal bank are short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Alexandra Candelaria works as a farmer growing corn, rice, and beans. She is requesting this loan to purchase seeds, insecticides, fertilizer, and supplies. She buys and sells her products in Ventanas.

This loan will help her expand her crops. Her dream is to finish remodeling her house. The challange she faces is the invasive weed known as Indian goosegrass or wiregrass. In her spare time she likes to watch television. She also enjoys house cleaning and washing.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticides, urea, fertilizer, and supplies

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para el negocio de la venta de tortillas, comprara maíz, leña y gas, que son los necesarios para la preparación de la venta, estos materiales lograra adquirirlos a menor precio por tener el dinero para cancelarlos de contado.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior, le ayudo a comprar el maíz, leña y gas con los que ha estado fabricando las tortillas, tambien ha realizado ventas de lociones, cosméticos, para mejorar sus ingresos, ella ha crecido con su negocio, ha contratado dos personas mas para que le ayuden a atender los clientes.
texts.en:
Catalina is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her business selling tortillas.  She will buy corn, firewood and propane gas, which she needs to prepare the products to sell.  Because she can buy with cash, she will be able to acquire these supplies at a lower price.

Catalina thinks that the previous loan helped her to buy corn, firewood and gas to make the tortillas.  She also made sales of lotions and cosmetics to increase her income.  Catalina has grown her business.  She has hired 2 more people to help her to tend to her customers.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and gas

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto, manifiesta que recibió una buena atención con el préstamo anterior, por eso solicita un nuevo financiamiento para el cultivo de granos básicos, comprándose seis sacos de abono y fertilizantes para realizar el trabajo en la siembra de maíz y ajonjolí.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar su economía debido a la compra de insumos que aumentaron sus ganancias, ha logrado tener en su familia una condición mas favorable.
texts.en:
Gilberto says his previous loan served him well, which is why he is requesting new financing in order to grow basic grains. He will purchase six sacks of fertilizer to be used on his corn and sesame crops. 

He believes the last loan helped him improve his financial situation because buying supplies allowed him to increase his profit and achieve more favorable conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro Pablo tiene 60 años, Es soltero vive solo tiene dos hijos pero son casados y no viven con el, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Pedro Pablo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Las compras de los productos lo hace en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito podra comprar los productos sin ningún tipo de problema. El sueño es construir una casa.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas la langosta y orosco.

En el tiempo libre le gusta cantar y leer.
texts.en:
Pedro Pablo is 60 years old.  He is single and lives alone.  He has 2 children, but they are both married and do not live with  him.  He lives in Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province.

The members of the communal bank "Luchando por una Misma Causa," meet in the La Primavera neighborhood of Ventanas canton.  These individuals are farmers who cultivate short cycle crops such as corn and rice.

Pedro Pablo works as a farmer, cultivating corn, rice, and beans.  He also raises chickens.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas.

Pedro Pablo is requesting a loan to buy seeds, supplies, and fertilizers for his crops.  With the support of this loan, he will be able to buy his supplies without any problems.  His dream is to build a house.

He faces the challenges of dealing with locust and grub infestations.

In his free time, he likes to sing and read.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque necesita tener mas capital para trabajar, comprara mariscos frescos, para la venta, como pescado, camarones, los cuales venderá a sus clientes, espera tener una mayor afluencia para sacar sus costos.
El ha mantenido su negocio en este tiempo, con el que ha ayudado a su familia, cubriendo los gastos alimenticios y mejorado algunas partes de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos is applying for a new loan because he needs to have more working capital. He will buy fresh seafood to sell, such as fish and shrimp, which he will then sell to his customers. He hopes to have greater revenue so that he can recover his costs. 

He has kept his business during this time, with which he has helped his family, by covering food expenses and improving some parts of their home.

loans.use: To buy fresh seafood, such as fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
13 son las mujeres que decidieron dejar sus miedos atrás y unirse en un comité para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo. La sra. Griselda es parte de este grupo,  se dedica a ser manicurista.
Ella se define como una persona honesta, que trabaja y trabaja duro por ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que necesitan. Ella sueña con seguir creciendo y trabajando y de esa forma procurar por su familia siempre.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de esmalte para uñas, removedor de esmalte, algodones, limas, cortauñas y demás elementos que necesite para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes, lo cual es lo que mas aprecian de ella.
texts.en:
Thirteen women decided to leave their fear behind them and form a bank to be able to help their families through their work.  Griselda is part of this group and she says she makes a living as a manicurist.

She's an honest person who works--and works hard--to help her family and give them everything they need.  She dreams of continuing to grow and working like that for her family forever.

She's requesting this loan to buy nail polish, nail polish remover, cotton balls, nail files, nail clippers, and other supplies she needs to continue giving her customers good service, which is what they most appreciate about her.

loans.use: to buy nail polish and remover, cotton, nail files, nail clippers, and other supplies

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Rita es la ciudad de Luque, tiene 13 miembros, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Se unieron con las ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias, por medio de su trabajo.
La Sra. Dora es la presidenta del grupo, ella es una persona que trabaja arduamente todos los días para salir adelante. Se dedica a hacer masajes, y cuenta que le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que de esa forma puede ayudar a las demás personas. Comenta que su meta es poder tener una clínica de masajes para poder seguir dando cada vez un mejor servicio.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar cremas, y ungüentos para poder usarlos a la hora de dar sus masajes.
texts.en:
