Por eso en la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual hará reparaciones locativas a su vivienda y con ello continuará  mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rigoberto says: “I feel very satisfied that thanks to support from Kiva lenders I’m able to still work and be productive though I’m an older person.”  He used his previous Kiva loan to once again buy synthetic fabric he used to manufacture home appliance slipcovers that he quickly sold.  This is why he’s applying for a new Kiva loan that he’ll use to make some home improvements to continue improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a food vendor. She sells kenkey, a staple food similar to sourdough, and serves it with okra soup and fish in Cape Coast. Ama is married and has three children. She supports her partner in educating, feeding and clothing their children. Her loan will be used to purchase maize and fish to cook and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a stall where she can sell her food.

loans.use: to purchase maize and fish to cook and sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama lives together with a husband who is a driver and 5 children at Akonma near Cape Coast. Ama  produces kenkey for sale (kenkey an African dish made out of maize).  Ama has been in this business for some time now. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children. Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for the production of kenkey for sale. With the new profit, Ama plan to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize  for the production of kenkey (sourdough dumpling) for sale

loans.name: Mwanamtama

texts.en:
Mwanamtama, 47, lives with her family in Msambweni which is in Coast Province. She considers herself to be a very cheerful person who enjoys her work and is very supportive of others.

She has had a small business selling fish from her home, a business she has been in for the last three years. The current loan, being her first with Yehu, is to buy more stock of fish and a weighing machine.

Her dream is to open a retail shop some day.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and a weighing machine.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 38 years old and a business man. He is married to Sarah, a business lady. They are blessed with four children. He has been a taxi driver for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family. 

Alexander is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD after being introduced by a credit officer. He will use the loan to open a retail shop. 

He will educate his children with the anticipated profit from the two businesses. His hopes and dreams are to buy another car for hiring services and to improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to open a retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase paint, paint brushes, and other tools

loans.name: Onike's' Group

texts.en:
Onike's group is comprised of 6 hard working women. Onike is 22 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Onike has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells flour, sugar, soap, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Onike has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more commodities like sodas, sugar, splash juice and cooking oil to resell. This investment will help Onike to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Onike hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Onike is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more commodities like sodas, sugar, splash juice and cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is a 24-years-old business man. He is married to Sarah and they currently have no children. He has been running a beauty salon for the past two years with the monthly income of KES. 20,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD, after being introduced to the service by a credit officer. Meshack will use the loan to buy a hair dryer and hair products for his salon. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and hair products for his salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more second hand clothing to resell.

loans.name: Domie

texts.en:
Domie is a 27-year-old fisherman from Nocnocan, Talibon. He has been in the fishing business for more than 5 years now. Domie is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for the boat. With these he will be able to enhance his daily catch thus allowing him to sell more fish in the market.
Domie hopes of making his business a success. He also wants to save money for the schooling of his two children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used items to resell.

loans.name: Nazipha

texts.en:
Nazipha is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Nazipha has been working hard to manage her small business which sells dry beans. 

To help expand her business, Nazipha has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more dry beans, and will help Nazipha to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Nazipha hopes that in the future, she will be able to build a good commercial house for herself. 

Nazipha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more dry beans

loans.name: Mwaniki

texts.en:
Mwaniki is a 21-year-old businessman. He is married to Eunice, a business lady. They are blessed with one child. He has been a taxi driver for the past three years with the monthly income of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings), which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD. after being introduced by a credit officer. Mwaniki will use the loan to open a retail shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to buy another car for hiring services and improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to open a retail shop.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda sells cooking utensils and saucepans in Akonoma near Cape Coast. She is married.  

Linda has been selling these items for two years now. She supports her husband in paying their accommodation and utility bills.  

She will use her loan to purchase more saucepans and cooking utensils for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her cooking utensils.

loans.use: to purchase more saucepans and cooking utensils for sale.

loans.name: Majdi

texts.en:
Majdi is a 31-year-old young man. He is married and a father to three sons and one daughter. Majdi is a Municipal employee who earns a low salary, not enough to cover all of the family's needs.

Majdi wants to improve his house's condition to offer better living conditions to his family, so he is requesting a USD 2,000 loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing paints and hiring workers to paint the house. This will ensure better living conditions for Majdi and his family so that they will enjoy living in their house.

Majdi is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase paints and hire workers.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel es una mujer de 38 años, en su juventud no alcanzó a continuar sus estudios en la universidad y terminó la secundaria. Es divorciada y ha tenido que salir adelante con sus 4 hijos a quienes educa para un día verlos convertidos en profesionales. Vive en el cantón Pastaza ubicado en la Provincia con el mismo nombre, perteneciente a la Región Amazónica de la República del Ecuador. La cabecera cantonal es la ciudad del Puyo una ciudad ubicada en medio de la selva amazónica al occidente de la provincia de Pastaza y a 924 m. sobre el nivel del mar. Es demográficamente pequeña pero tiene una gran variedad de sitios que son los preferidos para turistas nacionales e internacionales sobre todo los de actividades ecológicas y de deportes extremos. Una ciudad que crece económicamente cada día por las actividades de comercio, ganadería, agricultura y turismo, por lo que en ella se han establecido sucursales de empresas financieras y comerciales que pretenden aprovechar la actividad económica que mantiene esta ciudad. La competencia entre microempresarios es muy grande, sin embargo cada uno ha puesto su valor agregado para ganar preferencia con los clientes. 
María Isabel ha buscado las formas de dar a sus hijos una buena educación y además la calidad de vida que ellos se merecen, es por eso que hace 10 años emprendió con un restaurant pequeño en donde ofrece comida rápida y tradicional. Son 10 horas las que invierte en esta actividad, esperando obtener recompensa rentable. Su padre le enseñó a llevar a cabo este negocio y está muy agradecida con él, pues gracias al espíritu emprendedor que heredó de su padre, María cada año mejora su negocio y aun cuando se quedó sin nada por un robó que sufrió en el local, no se ha dado por vencida, inclusive ha buscado otras alternativas de generar ingresos como es la venta de ropa por catálogo. En muchas ocasiones sus clientes compran los platos que prepara María pero tienen que servirse sin la comodidad de una mesa o una silla, ya que las pocas mesas con las que cuenta en el local siempre están ocupadas. Es por eso que María ha solicitado un préstamo que lo utilizará en la compra de mobiliario para adecuar su restaurant con las comodidades que demandan sus clientes. Ella encontró en Fundación Alternativa la mejor opción para solicitar este crédito, ya que en esta institución se preocupan porque las personas superen la pobreza y además le brindan asesoría y facilidad para la obtención de crédito. María Isabel espera que con esta inversión sus ventas se multipliquen y su negocio genere más utilidades que le permitan reinvertir y también mejorar su estilo de vida y el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Isabel is a thirty-eight-year-old woman, who, when she was young, did not succeed in continuing on to university studies and completed her studies after high school.  She's divorced and has had to get ahead with four children who she's sending to school so that one day they'll become professionals.  She lives in the Pastaza canton, located in the province of the same name, in the Amazon region of the Republic of Ecuador.

The capital of the canton is the city of Puyo, located in the middle of the of the Amazon jungle in the western portion of Pastaza Province and is at 924m above sea level.   The population is small, but there is a wide variety of areas preferred by domestic and international tourists, primarily for ecological activities and extreme sports.  It's a city that is growing by the day economically due to commerce, livestock, agriculture, and tourism, and so financial and commercial companies have established branches to take advantage of the economic activity the city supports.  Competition among small-business people is very stiff, yet they all offer up their added value in order to win clients' favor.

María Isabel has sought out ways to give her children a good education and the quality of life they deserve, so she has invested ten years running a small restaurant where she offers fast food and traditional food, waiting to earn a profitable reward.  Her father taught her how to run this kind of business and she's very grateful to him, because, thanks to the entrepreneurial spirit she inherited from him, she improves the business every year.  Even when the business was robbed and left her with nothing, she was not defeated, and has even looked for other alternative to make money, like catalog clothing sales.

So often, Marías clients order the dishes she prepares, but have to be served without the comfort of tables and chairs because the few tables the restaurant has are always filled.  That's why María is seeking loan, so she can buy furniture to outfit her restaurant with the comfort clients demand.  She found Fundación Alternativa to be the best option for getting a loan, because the institution concerns itself with helping people overcome poverty by provides lending advice and facilitating loans.  María Isabel hopes that, with the investment, her sales will multiply and her business will generate more profits that she can reinvest to improve her and her children's lifestyle.

loans.use: para comprar mesas y sillas que le permitan recibir mas clientes para incrementar sus ventas

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es: Maria de 44 años de edad,  se dedica  a la venta de mercancía en general como calzado ropa, perfumes, cremas, y accesorios femeninos, además es empleada del servicio doméstico, y alrededor de este trabajo  ha estructurado su clientela  ofreciendo los artículos que vende a crédito. Ella tiene un año de experiencia y  decidió comercializar los productos con el fin de genera ingresos, su historial crediticio lo inició en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con un crédito de vivienda en el macroproyecto Villas de San Pablo, pues recibió un subsidio del estado nacional para cumplir su sueño de tener su casa propia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, para  comprar ropa, calzado, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, y accesorios femeninos, para continuar ampliando su negocio, en un momento importante en el cual sus ventas usualmente se incrementan, como en la temporada navideña y con la llegada del nuevo año, debido a que todas las familias se visten elegantes para estas festividades familiares. Su meta principal es lograr educar a sus hijos, que hoy están en las edades de 19 y 21 años, para que tengan un potencial de éxito en su futuro.
texts.en:
44-year old Maria runs a store selling merchandise such as footwear, clothing, lotions, and women's accessories. She sells some items to her customers on credit. As well she works as a maid. Maria has one year experience with her business; she started it in order to earn extra income.

Maria started taking out loans with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and received a housing loan in the Villas de San Pablo project. Then she received a state subsidy to fulfill her dream of having a house of her own.

Now she is seeking a loan to buy clothing, footwear, perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and women's accessories so she can continue expanding her store at this important time of year when sales increase: Christmas and the New Year. This is when everyone gets dressed up to attend family festivities.

Maria's principal goal is to educate her children who are now 19 and 21 years old so they can have success in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothing, footwear, perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and accessories

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margoth Elizabeth

texts.es:
Margoth Elizabeth tiene 22 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos vive con la madre en Guaranda Sector Cuatro Esquinas Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC Cuatro Esquinas Central. esta ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina conformada por 16 socios que son de la misma comunidad.

Margoth Elizabeth se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, pollos, además estudia. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en la Ciudad de Guaranda y en el sector donde vive.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos, balanceado y vacunas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar las vacunas para que los animales esten en buenas condiciones para venderlos.
El sueño es tener un propio camión. Los deafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y disgrutar de las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Margoth Elizabeth is 22 years old.  She is single, doesn't have any children, and lives with her mother in Cuatro Esquinas neighborhood, in Guaranda, in Bolívar province.

Margoth Elizabeth is a member of the 'Cuatro Esquinas Central' group which is located 20 minutes from the office.  It has 16 members who are all from the same community.

Margoth Elizabeth's business is raising pigs and chickens.  She also studies.  She makes her sales and purchases in the city of Guaranda and in her own neighborhood.

Margoth Elizabeth is requesting this loan to buy chickens, nutritionally-balanced feed and vaccines.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy vaccines so that her animals are in a good condition before she sells them.

Margoth Elizabeth's dream is to own her own truck.  The challenge that she faces is one of competition.  In her free time, she enjoys relaxing and taking part in Carnaval celebrations.

loans.use: to buy chickens, nutritionally-balanced feed and vaccines

loans.name: Nestan

texts.en:
Nestan is 51 years old. She lives in the small village of Abasha District with her mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Nestan requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, she has land where 100 nut trees are grown. Nestan sells approximately 200-250 kg nuts seasonally. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Nestan requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved within the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Nestan will purchase a calf. After purchasing a calf, she will raise it and produce dairy products to sell. It will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy a calf to raise and produce dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Topista

texts.en:
Topista is 22 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Topista has been working hard to manage her small clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Topista has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to resell and will help Topista to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Topista hopes that, in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Topista is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She and her husband have been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income.

Teodora is asking for a loan to buy fuel for the boat and to pay for the school fees for her children. In the future, Teodora hopes to make their business a success and sustainable for their needs and daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the boat and to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a petty trader. She sells utensils, saucepans, and plastic bowls in Cape Coast, which she has done for some years now. She is married with 2 children. 

Rebecca uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Rebecca will use her loan to purchase utensils, a saucepan, and  plastic bowls to sell. With the profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase utensils, a saucepan, and plastic bowls to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single lady who lives in the town of Msambweni. She is 47 years old, energetic, and hardworking who despite being single, has the urge to develop herself. Last year, she decided to have a small grocery store in the neighborhood. She currently has obtained a little experience to keep her going.

Mariam is asking for her first loan to expand her business premise and add stock of flour and basic grains.

She is a woman who is very dedicated to her work; she’s responsible and very enthusiastic about getting ahead. She’s always on the lookout for new opportunities that will open doors to success. She’s not willing to give up because she knows she’ll be able to attain a more prosperous future this way.

She promises to be punctual in repaying her loan so that she is able to ask for more loans and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to expand her business premise and add stock of flour and basic grains.

loans.name: Laura Matilde

texts.es:
Laura Matilde tiene 36 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo vive en Guaranda Sector Cuatro esquinas Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC Cuatro Esquinas Central. esta ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina conformada por 16 socios que son de la misma comunidad.

Laura Matilde se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos.  
Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos, vacunas, balanceado. Las compras y las ventas los realiza en Guaranda.Con la ayuda del crédito podrá continuar con el negocio.

El sueño es tener un propio vehículo para transportar los animales. El desafío al que se enfrenta es la competencia.
En los momentos libres le gusta descansar y disfrutar de la época de navidad.
texts.en:
Laura Matilde is 36 years old. She is married and has one child. She lives in the Cuatro Esquinas neighborhood of Guaranda, in the province of Bolívar.

She is a member of the Cuatro Esquinas Central community bank. She lives twenty minutes from the office. The community bank is made up of 16 members who all live in Cuatro Esquinas. 

Laura Matilde makes a living raising and selling chickens. She has requested a loan to buy chickens, vaccinations, and chicken feed. She makes her purchases and sales in Guaranda. With the help of this loan she will be able to continue her business.  

Her dream is to have her own vehicle which she can use to transport the animals. The challenge she has come across is her competition. In her free time she likes to relax and is looking forward to enjoying the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy chickens, vaccinations and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fruit for fruit selling business

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a fisherman from Nocnocan, Talibon, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for several years now. This is the source of his income. Walter gives his best to earn a living so that he can support his family, especially the schooling of his children. He is asking for a loan to buy fuel for the fishing boat. With this, he will be able to go back to fishing again.

In the future, Walter wants to improve his business and plans on exploring other ventures to augment his business.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the fishing boat

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha, 28, lives in the town of Msambweni, Kenya with her spouse and two children. A year and a half ago she started her own fast-food business aiming at earning income to support the family. The business is located on a busy street that leads to the market.

She’s asking for her first loan for 20,000 KES to buy more furniture, like benches and tables for her food stall. This loan will help her capitalize and get the business going. Her goal is to increase sales and income to be able to help pay for her children’s schooling and to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more furniture like benches and tables for her food stall.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
This is Soledad, 47, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Geronimo and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Soledad operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and also a variety of hanging plants and others alike. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Soledad is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Soledad dreams to grow her business in the coming years and hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. 
A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and garden inputs for her business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a 42-year-old, retail merchant who has worked in the same manner for many years. She is very well known in different neighborhoods. She lives with her family, for whom she works very hard daily to help her husband with the household expenses.

Asha sells fish from her home, a business she has gained experience with for the last 3 years. She is soliciting a loan through Yehu due to her enormous desire to improve her earnings and also, to be able to make her business grow, delivering greater benefits for her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo for a livestock business

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak is married and has six young children. She has always wanted to provide them with a good education, and, since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, she decided to start a new business. Muborak took a women's business course, called "To Get Ahead," where she learned valuable business skills. 

Muborak wants to start working in animal husbandry to generate income to contribute to her family's finances. Her children will help her with the business. Muborak is hardworking and smart, which will help her succeed. 

She is asking for a loan of 15,000 TJS to buy cattle for her new business. This loan will help her family have a good quality of life and open further financial opportunities. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Urbano

texts.es:
Urbano es un hombre de 42 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, es padres soltero, tiene 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Urbano no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, puesto que su familia era muy humilde, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para engreír a sus hijos, ya que esta es su comida favorita.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Urbano trabaja brindando servicios de carga, él cuenta con una pequeña motocarga la cual utiliza para trabajar, Urbano trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Urbano se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y el mantenimiento general de su motocarga, de esta manera podrá contar con su herramienta de trabajo en buenas condiciones para poder seguir brindando sus servicios, así pues Urbano seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Urbano is a 42-year-old, who lives in the city of Chiclayo. He is a single dad to two children who he loves and who are his driving force in life. Urbano is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who puts all his effort into getting his family ahead in life. Unfortunately Urbano was unable to finish primary school as he had to work from very early on to support his parents given that his family had a very low income, although he very much would have liked to have pursued a professional career in Accountancy. In his free time, Urbano likes watching television and on some occasions cooks a delicious dish of rice with duck to spoil his children as it is their favorite food.

At his own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Urbano works providing his freighting services, and has a small motorcycle with an attached trailer which he uses to work. Urbano works every day from the early hours in the morning and he can do this for approximately 12 hours. He feels comfortable performing his job and thinks that it is going well because of the friendly treatment that he offers to his customers.

Urbano is very grateful to the Kiva loan lenders as it is thanks to the help given that he will be able to repair and overhaul his motorcycle. In this manner he will be able to rely on his work tool that is in good conditions to continue offering his services. That is how Urbano will continue working and forging ahead to make his biggest dream come true, that of seeing his children become good professionals.

loans.use: to repair and overhaul his motorcycle with an attached trailer.

loans.name: Ason

texts.en:
Ason is married, has two children and four dependents who are relatives. He works four hours a day, six days a week and is typically an agriculturalist. Ason wants a loan to buy more animals to keep on his farm to sell in the future, and he also sells animal products such as milk and manure.

Ason's clients are the nearby people who buy milk from his farm, to use in the production of milk products like ghee butter, and manure for their banana plantations, since most of his neighbors are farmers. He hopes that if he gets financial assistance he will start processing a large stock of composed manure, which he can sell to earn some income. He also intends to buy more dairy cows to produce more milk and milk products, because he also plans to buy milking machines in the near future.

Ason's challenges include animal diseases and the existence of some local breeds on his farm which do not yield much in terms of milk production. His wish is to get support from willing organizations so as to expand his farm. He also has plans of producing biogas.

loans.use: to buy cows that he will raise and sell after some time.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Oliver's Group

texts.en:
Oliver's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Oliver is 25 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki, in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children; one of them is currently in school. For the past two years, Oliver has been working hard to manage her small clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more fashionable clothes for resale. This loan use will help Oliver to generate greater profits and to pay for her medical expenses. Oliver hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business into a bigger shop that sells clothes. 

Oliver is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fasionable clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena cooks banku and serves it with okra soup and fish, at Akonoma, near Cape Coast. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. She supports her husband to educate, feed and clothe her children. 

Mena will use her loan to purchase bags of maize, vegetables, fish and other ingredients, to use in cooking her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to establish a stall in which she can sell her food.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of the ingredients she uses, to cook her banku for sale.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, Lilian has been working hard to manage her salon, which provides hairdressing services. 

To help expand her business, Lilian has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more styled hair extensions. This will help Lilian to generate greater profits and provide for her own and her family's basic needs. Lilian hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a bigger salon. 

Lilian is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions for sale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 38-year-old single business lady and mother of two children. She has been selling ground nuts as a primary business and dairy farming as a secondary business for the past four years. She uses her monthly income of 20,000 KES to support her family. 

Lucy is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the program by a credit officer. Lucy will use the loan to buy sacks of ground nuts and animal feed. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, Lucy plans to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy sacks of ground nuts and animal feed.
